pageContext.claim: “Unemployment among African Americans, Asian Americans, and Hispanic Americans have all reached their lowest levels in the history of our country.”
pageContext.analysis: The current African American unemployment statistic has been in existence for less than 50 years. It reached a low of 5.9 percent in May 2018, but rose to 6.0 percent in July. An older set of government data suggests black unemployment went much lower in the 1950s. The Asian-American statistic has been around for less than 20 years. And while it reached a low of 2.0 percent rate in May 2018, it rose to 2.9 percent in August, the most recent month available. Hispanic unemployment has also rebounded. Lately, Trump has been using the word "reached," perhaps to indicate the lows are in the past.
